titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John B. Wilkerson, Judgment
CWG9818

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Nelson Circuit Court.
The Commlth. of Kentucky,,
against
John B. Wilkerson,,

The Grand Jury of Nelson County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John B Wilkerson of the crime of maliciously and wilfully shooting and wounding with intent to kill, committed as follows: the Said John B Wilkerson on the 1st day of March 1858 in the County aforesaid did willfully maliciously and feloniously Shoot at and Wound with intent to Kill one Electins Adams with a pistol loaded with powder and a leaden ballsullits without Killing Said Electins Adams against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --
Rudy Barnett atty for the Commonwealth

Upon which indictment the folowing verdict was rendered,, "We of the Jury find the defendant John B Wilkerson not guilty of the malicious Shotting & wounding as charged in the within indictment, but we find him guilty of Shooting & wounding E. Adams in Sudden heat without previous malice and not in self defense and in consequence thereof do fix his punishment at a fine of Fifty Dollars and Six months Confinement in the County jail

Fr Realmear
one of the Jury

A Copy att Wm Murphy Clk
By Wm Laughlin D C
